critique: The document is an executive order amending a previous order regarding the admission of deaf mutes to civil service examinations. It expands the scope of positions deaf mutes may be considered for, contingent on the heads of Executive Departments deeming them capable. This suggests a move towards social inclusion. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power dynamics, federalism implications, national security concerns, or economic regulation. The primary focus is on accommodating individuals with disabilities within the civil service.
